On Jun 2, 2006, at 4:01 AM, junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

>   I need some information regarding JUnit. All I have heard is that  
> JUnit can and is used widely for unit testing the JAVA code.
>   Can the JUnit be used to test the GUI related applications? If  
> so, how can we use it for system testing of GUI applications.

The answer is yes, JUnit can be used to test GUI applications; but  
probably not in the way you think.  JUnit is a programmers testing  
tool, not a testers testing tool.  To use JUnit you have to write  
lots of Java code.  In my experience the amount of Java code you  
write is roughly equal to the amount of java code being tested.

There are other tools that are better for GUI system testing.  Take a  
look at FitNesse and Selenium, for example.
